BharatFinTrack.nse_track module

class BharatFinTrack.nse_track.NSETrack

Bases: object

Represents characteristics of NSE finance products.

property indices_all

Returns a list of all indices names.

property indices_base_date

Returns a dictionary where keys are indices and values are their corresponding base dates.

property indices_category

Returns a list categories for NSE indices.

indices_name(category)

Returns NSE indices for a specified category.

Parameters:

category (str) – The classification type of NSE indices.

Returns:

A list containing the names of indices for the specified category.

Return type:

list

BharatFinTrack.nse_tri module

class BharatFinTrack.nse_tri.NSETRI

Bases: object

Download and analyze NSE total return index data.

indices_all

A list of all NSE index names, obtained from the NSETrack.indices_all attribute.

Type:

list

indices_base_date

A dictionary where keys are indices and values are their corresponding base dates, obtained from the NSETrack.indices_base_date attribute.

Type:

dict

_api_tri

A dictionary used to store API-related information for total return indices.

Type:

dict

historical_daily_data(index_name, start_date=None, end_date=None, input_headers=None)

Generate historical daily total return index data between start and end dates, both inclusive.

Parameters:

  • index_name (str) – Name of the index. Refer to the NSETRI.indices_all attribute.

  • start_date (str, optional) – Start date string in the format ‘DD-MMM-YYYY’. If None is given, the base date of the index is used as the start date.

  • end_date (str, optional) – End date string in the format ‘DD-MMM-YYYY’. If None is given, the current date is used as the end date.

  • input_headers (dict, optional) – HTTP headers for the request, if different from the default value. Refer to the Core.default_headers attribute.

Returns:

A Pandas DataFrame with two columns: ‘Date’ and ‘Close’. The ‘Date’ column contains datetime.date objects, and the ‘Close’ column contains the closing float values of the index.

Return type:

DataFrame

dict

historical_daily_data(index_name, start_date=None, end_date=None, input_headers=None)

Generate historical daily total return index data between start and end dates, both inclusive.

Parameters:

  • index_name (str) – Name of the index. Refer to the NSETRI.indices_all attribute.

  • start_date (str, optional) – Start date string in the format ‘DD-MMM-YYYY’. If None is given, the base date of the index is used as the start date.

  • end_date (str, optional) – End date string in the format ‘DD-MMM-YYYY’. If None is given, the current date is used as the end date.

  • input_headers (dict, optional) – HTTP headers for the request, if different from the default value. Refer to the Core.default_headers attribute.

Returns:

A Pandas DataFrame with two columns: ‘Date’ and ‘Close’. The ‘Date’ column contains datetime.date objects, and the ‘Close’ column contains the closing float values of the index.

Return type:

DataFrame
